senses.sense_definition: A trussed frame extending fore and aft, usually above deck, and intended to increase the longitudinal strength and stiffness, used chiefly in American river and lake steamers.

examples.text: The naval architect explained how the <w>hogframe</w> distributes tension across the upper deck to prevent the hull from sagging.
Historical diagrams of the paddle steamer clearly show the arched <w>hogframe</w> spanning the length of the ship.

traits.comment: specific to American river and lake steamers
